title: History of Gaudiya Vaishnavism | Sri Jai Chaitanya Dasa | Gaura Mandala Parikrama 2024
speaker: HG Jai Chaitanya Dasa

segments.key_quote: Chaitanya Mahaprabhu did a lot of preaching but real organized preaching was done by these three personalities
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the three main preachers after Chaitanya Mahaprabhu: Srinivas Acharya, Narottam Das Thakur, and Shyamananda Prabhu, emphasizing their role in organized preaching.
segments.transcript: So, it looks like this was a big temple once upon a time, a lot of dilapidated buildings. These are the work of the great preachers, like we said in the morning, the first set of preachers after Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, three people, three personalities: Srinivas Acharya, Narottam Das Thakur, and Shyamananda Prabhu. These were the first three preachers with the Shakti of Gauranga. All of them were very sad that they were born just after Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, they couldn't see Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, so they were the Shakti of Chaitanya Mahaprabhu to initiate the preaching. Chaitanya Mahaprabhu did a lot of preaching, but real organized preaching was done by these three personalities.

segments.key_quote: So we are basically seeing the three main preachers their places are what is coming in this in this circuit so many stories connected to these three personalities
segments.summary: The speaker outlines the itinerary of visiting the places associated with the three main preachers, mentioning their preaching areas and some stories connected to them.
segments.transcript: So that is how we covered Shyamananda Prabhu's place. This is another extension of Shyamananda Prabhu's place, Rishikananda, his own disciple. And then tomorrow, of course, we are in Bhaura-Hugli area, all the different small, small temples. Then we'll be going to Vishnupur, which is Srinivas Acharya's place. Then as we go towards the border of Bangladesh, we'll see Narottam Das Thakur's place. So we are basically seeing the three main preachers, their places are what is coming in this circuit. So many stories connected to these three personalities. They were sent by Jeeva Goswami to bring all the books of the Goswamis. All the Rupa Goswamis, Sanatan Goswami, all their books were brought, you know the story, on a big bullock cart the books were brought and it was stolen. So we'll be going day after tomorrow to the dacoit king's city called Vishnupur, very beautiful place. That is Srinivas Acharya. So we see the strength of the preaching of these acharyas all over Orissa and bordering of Bengal. Shyamananda did north Bengal, Srinivas Acharya did Bangladesh, Narottam Das Thakur, Srinivas Acharya went all the way to Tripura and also Manipur. So this whole place was actually preached, organized way, by these personalities.

segments.key_quote: so today also that is the same system we follow go to your place take a place put have the details installed and start preaching so this system is not something new it is going on from naratham das taku's time onwards
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the tradition of deity installation, highlighting Narottam Das Thakur's role and contrasting how deities were received in the past versus the present.
segments.transcript: And that is a footstep we are also following, the organized preaching form. The first temple was built by Narottam Das Thakur. The first Gopunima was done by him in Keturi ground. We'll see that, where Janava Mata himself, herself, and Nithyananda Prabhu's wife, she was present. So today also that is the same system we follow: go to your place, take a place, put, have the deities installed and start preaching. So this system is not something new, it is going on from Narottam Das Thakur's time onwards. They all went, installed duties, but the difference is that these personalities got deities and they dream, they got deities from Radharani. We have to make deities and then install them as Kali Yuga goes on.

segments.key_quote: but there's chaitanya mahaprabhu's shakti so was that with all our weaknesses he is making us to preach continue preaching this message of chaitanya mahaprabhu
segments.summary: The speaker reflects on the diminishing strength of preachers in Kali Yuga but emphasizes the power of Chaitanya Mahaprabhu's shakti and discusses the lineage (parampara) from Nityananda Prabhu.
segments.transcript: Now the strength of the preachers are going down, but there's Chaitanya Mahaprabhu's Shakti, so with all our weaknesses, He is making us to preach, continue preaching this message of Chaitanya Mahaprabhu. But these preachers were Shakti away by themselves, Shyamananda, Narottam, Srinivas. So Shyamananda Prabhu, as we read a little bit in the previous temple, same line as Nithyananda. So we are also Nithyananda, coming down from Janava Mata and Narottam Das Thakur, Vishwanath Chakravarti. So this is our line. However, as far as these are concerned, they are a little different, even though they are from Nithyananda Prabhu's Vamsha because of the tilak mark, right? There's a little different, but basically...

segments.key_quote: So to solve this, his own Guru from Mayapur, from Ambika Kalna. From there, Gauridas Pandit's disciple Hridayachaitanya went all the way to Vandavan to settle this issue.
segments.summary: The speaker recounts the controversy surrounding Shyamananda Prabhu's tilak and how it was resolved, emphasizing the roles of Hridayachaitanya and Jiva Goswami.
segments.transcript: we have the same parampara. So there was a controversy long time back in Mindavan with this tilak, Dukhi Krishna, the disciple of Krita Chaitanya, when he went to Vrindavan, he had this connection with Lalitha Sakhi and Radharani and he got this Tilak. All the people said that he took reinitiation from Jeeva Goswami and Jeeva Goswami has changed his name from Dukhi Krishna to Shamananda. This whole kind of controversy erupted in Vandavan. So to solve this, his own Guru from Mayapur, from Ambika Kalna. From there, Gauridas Pandit's disciple Hridayachaitanya went all the way to Vandavan to settle this issue. But then finally, to make the story short, that it was proven that this Tilak was handed over by Radharani herself to Shamananda and he did not change anything. He considered Hridayachaitanya as his Guru, but Jeeva Goswami and Radharani did not change anything. He considered Hridayachaitanya as his Shiksa Guru for further preaching. So these great personalities went to Jeeva Goswami and Radharani who was a disciple of Lokannath, all went to Jeeva Goswami friend. for further preaching. So these great personalities all went to Jeeva Goswami friend. Narottam Dashtakul who was a disciple of Lokannath also went to Jeeva Goswami to learn. Shamananda, a disciple of Hridayachaitanya went to Jeeva Goswami to learn. And Srinivasacharya's disciple was...

segments.key_quote: So, basically Jiva Goswami is the real authority on Gaudiya Vaishnavism.
segments.summary: The speaker asserts Jiva Goswami's authority in Gaudiya Vaishnavism and discusses the challenge faced by the tradition regarding a commentary (bhashya) on the Brahma Sutras.
segments.transcript: Gopalabhadra Goswami. He also was given under the care of Jeeva Goswami. And Gopalabhadra Goswami had the guidance and guidance like I said. So I am a disciple and the Hadith was So, basically Jiva Goswami is the real authority on Gaudiya Vaishnavism. Prabhupada said Jiva Goswami is the authority, especially because of the shakshandarva he wrote conclusive truth about Krishna, Krishna is the Bhagavan Swayam. And then Baladeva Vidyabhushan, today morning you went to his birthplace. So these personalities actually fixed Gaudiya Vaishnavism as authorized parampara within the Madhya Gaudiya parampara. Especially the Ramanandis and the Ramanujacharyas, they were saying there is no authority to the Gaudiya Vaishnavism, where is your siddhanta coming from and where is your bhashya on the Brahma Sutras. Unless we have a bhashya on Brahma Sutras, we are not going to be able to understand Brahma Sutras. You are not considered an authorized line, because Sri Vaishnavas have their authorized bhashya, Madhya has their authorized bhashya. But what about Gaudiya Vaishnavism?

segments.key_quote: So there was a challenge, that is when Baladeva Dhyabhushan went to Jaipur, we know the story how he took the blessing of Govinda and in few days he wrote this bhashya.
segments.summary: The speaker narrates the story of Baladeva Vidyabhushana writing the Govinda Bhashya to establish the authority of Gaudiya Vaishnavism.
segments.transcript: So there was a challenge, that is when Baladeva Vidyabhushan went to Jaipur, we know the story how he took the blessing of Govinda and in few days he wrote this bhashya. Vishwanath Chakravarti Thakur was a great person. He had authority in those times, but he was very old, so he didn't go to Jaipur, he sent his disciple Baladeva, so Baladeva Vidyabhushan went there and he wrote this bhashya and called it Govinda Bhashya on the 500 sutras of Brahma Sutra. So Prabhupada Goswami, Sanatana Goswami, Jeeva Goswami, Vishwanath Chakravarti Thakur, Baladeva Vidyabhushan. And these three preachers, they were the solid foundation for Chaitanya Mahaprabhu to create a big foundation for Gaudiya Vaishnavism.

segments.key_quote: Before Bhaktivinoda Thakur revived it, there was a time when the whole Gaudiya Vaishnavism was almost lost, which was revived by Bhaktivinoda Thakur.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the revival of Gaudiya Vaishnavism by Bhaktivinoda Thakur and the subsequent global spread by Srila Prabhupada through ISKCON.
segments.transcript: Before Bhaktivinoda Thakur revived it, there was a time when the whole Gaudiya Vaishnavism was almost lost, which was revived by Bhaktivinoda Thakur. Not long back, 500 years back, still way down 200, 200, 300 years back it got lost, then again Bhaktivinoda Thakur had to revive it. And then Bhaktivinoda Thakur had to establish another foundation with his 64 Gaudiya Maths. And then it was for our Prabhupada, Bhaktivedanta Swami Srila Prabhupada to take it all over the world. Now Gaudiya Vaishnavism is like authority, people say, oh Janmashtami, the way ISKCON is doing, Abhishekam, the way ISKCON is doing, so ISKCON has become a kind of a, what do you call it, benchmark for Bhaktivinoda. Yes. Bhakti. So these great personalities have done great jobs, so we are visiting these people's...

segments.key_quote: But for us the challenge is we are preaching to hardcore, hardcore, we ourselves are hardcore materialists and we are preaching to hardcore materialists.
segments.summary: The speaker reflects on the challenges of preaching to a materialistic audience compared to the past, emphasizing the power of Prabhupada's message.
segments.transcript: place and remember their sacrifices and we are taking it forward. All of us as preachers, we have our chota-chota jobs and our chota-chota deshas where we preach in different places. But there's a whole force behind that, there's a whole force behind this, there's a whole authority to books. There's a whole authority to conclusions and the whole tradition left by these people. So it's good that we take some time off and see all these places with the Vaishnavas to inspire ourselves and to charge ourselves and go and give it. The only difference is that these personalities we are preaching to people who are very simple. May not be very Vedic, what 50, 60, 100 or 200 years back or 300 years back, people were much more simple. But for us the challenge is we are preaching to hardcore, hardcore, we ourselves are hardcore materialists and we are preaching to hardcore materialists. So the difference is that. And they had the strength of Sanskrit and the strength of Vedic education. What do we have? We just parrot what Prabhupada said, that's it. But that voice of Prabhupada is so strong that it can change the world. Yes. It can change the hearts of thousands of people even though it is just going through our mouth. So we are just postman delivering the message of Prabhupada to the whole world. He is doing the preaching. So the great personality who is doing preaching now and continuing for next 10,000 years is Prabhupada.
